title: The Monkey Programming Language
description: An interpreter/compiler for the Monkey language as presented in Thorsten Ball’s books, extended with extra built-in functions and VM introspection utilities.
challenge: Translating concepts from an educational book directly into production-grade Go code, extending functionality while maintaining clarity.
solution: Followed the book’s architecture to build both an AST interpreter and a VM compiler, adding `exit()`, hash introspection, and type-conversion helpers in Go.
